summary: A cancer found in the uterus, ovaries, fallopian tubes, and other body parts, characterized by the presence of both carcinomatous (epithelial) and sarcomatous (connective) tissue components. It is divided into homologous and heterologous types based on the origin of the sarcomatous component.
diagnosis: Histology (adenocarcinoma mixed with malignant mesenchymal elements)
Gross appearance (fleshy, bulky, polypoid, protruding through cervical os)
